required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of ^14C-LY2835219 in Healthy Participants
clinical_study.official_title: Disposition of [^14C]-LY2835219 Following Oral Administration in Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock:
This type of study is called a radiolabeled study. For this study, LY2835219 (study drug) has been specially prepared to contain radiolabeled carbon [14C]. [14C] is a naturally occurring radioactive form of the element carbon. This study will help understand how the drug appears in the blood, urine, and stool after it is administered.
In addition, this study will also evaluate the safety and tolerability of a single dose of LY2835219 when given to healthy participants. Information about any side effects that may occur will also be collected.
This study will last about 3 weeks for each participant, not including screening.

primary_outcome.measure: Urinary and Fecal Excretion of LY2835219-Related Radioactivity Over Time Expressed as a Percentage of the Total Radioactive Dose Administered

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Pharmacokinetics (PK) of LY2835219 and Metabolites and Radioactivity Maximum Observed Concentration (Cmax)
Plasma Pharmacokinetics (PK) of LY2835219 and Metabolites and Radioactivity Time of Maximum Observed Concentration (tmax)

Plasma Pharmacokinetics (PK) of LY2835219 and Metabolites and Radioactivity Area under the Concentration-Time Curve from Time Zero to the Last Timepoint with a Measurable Concentration (AUC 0 to tlast)
Plasma Pharmacokinetics (PK) of LY2835219 and Metabolites and Radioactivity Area Under the Concentration Versus Time Curve from Zero to Infinity (AUC 0-âˆž)
Relative Abundance of LY2835219 and Metabolites of LY2835219 in Urine and Feces
Relative Abundance of LY2835219 and Metabolites of LY2835219 in Plasma

arm_group.description: Single 150 milligram (mg) oral dose solution of LY2835219 containing 5 micro curies of [^14C] labeled drug

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Overtly healthy male or female participants as determined by medical history and physical examination
- Male participants will be sterile
- Female participants will be surgically sterile or postmenopausal
- Have a body mass index (BMI) of 18 to 29 kilograms per square meter (kg/m^2)
- Have venous access sufficient to allow for blood sampling
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have a history or presence of cardiovascular, respiratory, hepatic, renal, gastrointestinal, endocrine, hematological, or neurological disorders capable of significantly altering the absorption, metabolism, or elimination of drugs; of constituting a risk when taking the study medication; or of interfering with the interpretation of data
- Gastrointestinal disorders causing clinically significant symptoms such as nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea, or malabsorption syndromes
